text: Babylon’s Fall
Come down and sit on \add the\add* dust, virgin daughter of Babylon!
Sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of Chaldea!
For ⸤they shall no longer call⸥\f + \fr 47:1 \ft Literally “you shall not add they shall call to” \f* you tender and delicate.
Take \add the\add* pair of mill stones and grind flour!
Uncover your veil,
strip off \add your\add* skirt,
uncover \add your\add* thigh,
pass through \add the\add* rivers!
Your nakedness shall be exposed;
indeed, your shame shall become visible.
I will take vengeance
and I will not ⸤spare⸥\f + \fr 47:3 \ft Literally “plead with” \f* a person.
Our redeemer, Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* his name, the holy one of Israel.
Sit silently and go into the darkness, daughter of Chaldea,
for ⸤they shall no longer call⸥\f + \fr 47:5 \ft Literally “you shall not add they shall call to” \f* you mistress of kingdoms.
I was angry with my people;
I profaned my inheritance,
and I gave them into your hand.
You did not ⸤give⸥\f + \fr 47:6 \ft Literally “set up” \f* them mercy;
on \add the\add* aged you made your yoke very heavy.
And you said, “I shall be an eternal mistress forever!”
You did not set these \add things\add* upon your heart;
you did not remember its end.
Therefore now hear this, luxuriant \add one\add* who sits\f + \fr 47:8 \ft Or “sitting” \f* in security,
who says\f + \fr 47:8 \ft Or “saying” \f* in her heart, “I \add am\add*, and besides me \add there is\add* no one.
I shall not sit \add as\add* a widow,
and I shall not know \add the\add* loss of children.”
And these two shall come to you \add in\add* a moment, in one day:
\add the\add* loss of children and widowhood shall come on you ⸤completely⸥,\f + \fr 47:9 \ft Literally “as their fullness” \f*
in spite of your many sorceries,
in spite of the power of your great enchantments.
And you felt secure in your wickedness;
you said, “⸤No one⸥\f + \fr 47:10 \ft Literally “none” \f* sees\f + \fr 47:10 \ft Or “\fq is \ft seeing” \f* me.”
Your wisdom and your knowledge led you astray,
and you said in your heart, “I \add am\add*, and besides me \add there is\add* no one.”
And evil shall come upon you, you will not know;
it will be on the lookout for her.
And disaster shall fall upon you; you will not be able to ⸤avert⸥\f + \fr 47:11 \ft Literally “make amends” \f* it.
And ruin shall come on you suddenly; you do not know.
Stand, now, in your enchantments,
and in your many sorceries with which you have labored from your youth.
Perhaps you may be able to benefit;
perhaps you may ⸤scare away⸥.\f + \fr 47:12 \ft Literally “terrify” \f*
You struggle with your many consultations;\f + \fr 47:13 \ft Or “advice” \f*
let them stand, now, and save you—
those who see the stars, divide \add the\add* ⸤celestial sphere⸥,\f + \fr 47:13 \ft Literally “heavens,” that is, for astrology \f*
who inform by new moons—
from \add those things\add* that are coming upon you.
Look! They are like stubble;
\add the\add* fire burns them completely.
They cannot deliver ⸤themselves⸥\f + \fr 47:14 \ft Literally “their lives” \f* from \add the\add* ⸤power⸥\f + \fr 47:14 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of \add the\add* flame;
there is no coal ⸤for warming oneself⸥,\f + \fr 47:14 \ft Literally “to grow warm” \f*
\add no\add* fire before which to sit.
So are to you \add those with\add* whom you have labored,
your traders from your youth.
They wander, each to his side;
there is no one who can save you.
